overview:
Founder of Access 360 Media (access360media.com), Founder of PTTOW! Media (pttow.com), Co-founder of movements.org (@aym) movements.org

Roman Tsunder has been at the forefront of the digital communications shift that includes industries such as social media, mobile, alternative and out-of-home media, video, gaming, action sports and entertainment. Roman is the Founder and most recently President of Access 360 Media, Inc., the nationâ€™s largest digital out-of-home media network comprised of leading malls such as Simon Property Group (largest global mall operator) and largest in-stadium digital network, comprised of 46 venues including Yankee Stadium, Madison Square Garden, Dodger Stadium, Staples Center, United Center and more, reaching nearly 100MM consumers each month. A3M has built out a multi-platform approach consisting of in-venue, online and mobile channels to connect with consumers at the point of purchase and the point of passion. A3Mâ€™s success can be attributed to a great team and partners such as AT&T, Omnicom, WPP, Simon Property Group, CBS, Fox, Pepsi, MTV, Warner Music, f.y.e., and 20th Century Fox. In 2009, Roman created the PTTOW! Media Summit, an invite only event bringing together 75 top CMO level execs from the worldâ€™s most innovative companies to discuss the future of the media industry, representing over $12 Billion in media spending across every major industry category, including: wireless (AT&T), clothing (Quiksilver); gaming (Activision), social media (Facebook), technology (HP), online video (YouTube), beverage (Pepsi), athletes (Kelly Slater) and the US Government. Roman has extensive operating and private equity experience specializing in social media, digital technology and consumer products. Roman has been recognized as a â€œRising Star: 40 under 40â€ by OC Magazine and Chain Store Age. Roman is a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles, where he received a B.A. in International Economics with Distinctive Honors, and holds a certificate in Language and Business Management from Moscow State University.
